summary: The document is a confidential memorandum from Lieutenant General Vernon A. Walters to the Acting Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, detailing the Agency's interactions with individuals and organizations linked to the Watergate Incident. It outlines recruitment, employment, and termination details, alongside connections to Cuban exile activities and operational cover support through entities like the Robert R. Mullen Company and General Foods Corporation. The memorandum underscores the sensitive nature of the shared information.
key_findings: Frank Anthony Sturgis had no recruitment record with the Agency but was associated with Eugenio Rolando Martinez Careaga, recruited in January 1961.
Bernard L. Barker was a contact from 1959 to 1960, terminated in 1966 with no further interactions.
No Agency connection was found for Virgilio Gonzales.
The Robert R. Mullen Company and General Foods Corporation provided cover support for operational activities, involving specific individuals.
James McCord was not involved in Cuban matters or the Bay of Pigs operation, though personal acquaintances were possible.
Everette Howard Hunt's activities, including his alias and assignment to the White House Staff, were detailed, along with his continued association with the Mullen Company.
Additional peripheral contacts and information were shared, all marked as confidential.
